html: Richard Lugar was a great man and an honorable statesman. A Rhodes Scholar, he served the people of Indiana in the Senate for 36 years and helped protect the world from nuclear weapons through his leadership. Annette and I offer our deepest condolences to his family at this time.

html: Today @POTUS approved the major disaster declaration for storms that occurred in the northwest region of Alabama from 2/19-3/20, ordering federal assistance for state & local recovery efforts. Grateful for the President’s help in repairing the damage.

html: #TaxDay is a reminder that our nation’s tax code is complex, confusing, & costly. html: Today I am saddened by the loss of a great friend, Senator Fritz Hollings, who represented SC in the Senate for nearly four decades. He was a former governor, presidential candidate, distinguished Citadel graduate, and Commerce Committee Chairman. Annette & I mourn his passing.

html: My former advisor, Mark Calabria, was just confirmed to serve as @FHFA director. This is excellent news for the #finance community in #AL & across the nation. I look forward to working w/ Mark in his new capacity as he uses his knowledge & experience to effectively lead the FHFA.

html: Huge news for #Alabama’s fishermen – the @GulfCouncil unanimously voted today to delegate management authority of recreational #redsnapper to the Gulf states. This is a vital step toward better management of the Gulf’s fishery.
text: Huge news for #Alabama’s fishermen – the @GulfCouncil unanimously voted today to delegate management authority of recreational #redsnapper to the Gulf states. This is a vital step toward better management of the Gulf’s fishery.

html: Today the Senate voted to prevent further delay on confirming hundreds of qualified nominees, just as Democrats did in 2013. I’m glad we can start processing these nominees in a timely manner and stop wasting time running out the procedural clock.
text: Today the Senate voted to prevent further delay on confirming hundreds of qualified nominees, just as Democrats did in 2013. I’m glad we can start processing these nominees in a timely manner and stop wasting time running out the procedural clock.

html: During the first 2 yrs of President Trump’s administration, #Democrats forced 128 cloture votes on his nominees. During President Obama’s first 2 yrs, he only faced a total of 12 cloture votes on his nominees. It’s time to put a stop to this historic obstruction.
text: During the first 2 yrs of President Trump’s administration, #Democrats forced 128 cloture votes on his nominees. During President Obama’s first 2 yrs, he only faced a total of 12 cloture votes on his nominees. It’s time to put a stop to this historic obstruction.

html: This evening, I spoke with @realDonaldTrump regarding my letter. He stated that he supports my call for Lindh to serve his full sentence. Lindh’s activities are deserving of a strong and strict punishment. Thank you, Mr. President.
text: This evening, I spoke with @realDonaldTrump regarding my letter. He stated that he supports my call for Lindh to serve his full sentence. Lindh’s activities are deserving of a strong and strict punishment. Thank you, Mr. President.

html: Lindh, an American who is believed to have had direct involvement in the death of CIA officer Mike Spann and plead guilty to supporting the Taliban in Afghanistan, is a threat to our national security and should serve the entirety of his 20 yr sentence.
text: Lindh, an American who is believed to have had direct involvement in the death of CIA officer Mike Spann and plead guilty to supporting the Taliban in Afghanistan, is a threat to our national security and should serve the entirety of his 20 yr sentence.

html: Last week, I sent a letter to the President expressing my deep concern about recent reports that John Walker Lindh, a man who supported the Taliban during 9/11, could be released from prison this May, years ahead of his full sentence.pic.twitter.com/aPyc2BFGH2
text: Last week, I sent a letter to the President expressing my deep concern about recent reports that John Walker Lindh, a man who supported the Taliban during 9/11, could be released from prison this May, years ahead of his full sentence.pic.twitter.com/aPyc2BFGH2

html: My office has reached out to local officials in the various areas hit by the tornadoes yesterday in Alabama. We stand ready to help as needed.

html: To everyone impacted by the devastating tornadoes that struck Lee County and other parts of Alabama today, my thoughts and prayers go out to you during this difficult time. I am deeply saddened by the loss of life, and grateful to the first responders on the scene.
text: To everyone impacted by the devastating tornadoes that struck Lee County and other parts of Alabama today, my thoughts and prayers go out to you during this difficult time. I am deeply saddened by the loss of life, and grateful to the first responders on the scene.

html: Today I'm honored to become Alabama's longest serving U.S. Senator. For the past 32 yrs, I've been fortunate to represent & serve the people of our great state. html: For the good of the country, I encourage my Democratic colleagues to either join us in passing the President’s proposal or come to the negotiating table with constructive solutions of their own. Saying no to everything will not move our nation forward.
text: For the good of the country, I encourage my Democratic colleagues to either join us in passing the President’s proposal or come to the negotiating table with constructive solutions of their own. Saying no to everything will not move our nation forward.

html: I reiterate my support for the proposal outlined by @POTUS. This is the only legislation before us that would fully reopen the government, complete our FY2019 appropriations process, & secure our borders with immigration policy priorities from both sides. It’s a fair compromise.

text:
We will #NeverForget

Many #Soldiers and service members were inspired to serve or motivated to return to the fight following Sept. 11, 2001. Please help us #honor our service members and Families for their sacrifices. We would like to hear your story. Share a photo or memory.pic.twitter.com/Q3lVdRh0tI

html: Today I was able to honor my good friend & colleague of over 30 years, @SenThadCochran, upon his retirement from the Senate. His extraordinarily impactful tenure will not be forgotten, & we should strive to continue on the path he has paved. He is a true southern gentleman.pic.twitter.com/nQwXfV8zRP

html: The opioid epidemic has become a national crisis. This #OmnibusBill provides significant funding for opioid prevention, treatment, and enforcement. It also increases @NIH funding to discover new advances in healthcare and medicine.
text: The opioid epidemic has become a national crisis. This #OmnibusBill provides significant funding for opioid prevention, treatment, and enforcement. It also increases @NIH funding to discover new advances in healthcare and medicine.

html: Renewing America's aging infrastructure is vital to our nation's future. Proud to see $21.1 billion in new infrastructure funding in this #OmnibusBill.
text: Renewing America's aging infrastructure is vital to our nation's future. Proud to see $21.1 billion in new infrastructure funding in this #OmnibusBill.

html: The #OmnibusBill provides the most significant increase in defense funding in 15 years, paving the way to rebuild our military. It is the largest investment in our Armed Forces since the beginning of the War on Terror.
text: The #OmnibusBill provides the most significant increase in defense funding in 15 years, paving the way to rebuild our military. It is the largest investment in our Armed Forces since the beginning of the War on Terror.
